segment.target: MD Using your Windows device with Intune

segment.source: Use these steps for tasks that you need to do on your Windows device or computer when your company is using Microsoft Intune:
segment.target: Use these steps for tasks that you need to do on your Windows device or computer when your company is using Microsoft Intune:

segment.source: Task category
segment.target: Task category

segment.source: Tasks you can do
segment.target: Tasks you can do

segment.target: Company Portal app installation and Intune enrollment

segment.target: What happens if I reset my Windows device using the Company Portal?

segment.target: Unenroll your device from Intune

segment.target: What happens when I remove my device from the Company Portal?

segment.target: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection

segment.target: Fix Intune issues with your device

segment.source: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version

segment.target: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version

segment.source: Enroll your Windows device in Intune
segment.target: Enroll your Windows device in Intune

segment.source: To enroll, use the link that corresponds to the device you are using:
segment.target: To enroll, use the link that corresponds to the device you are using:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1

segment.source: Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1

segment.source: Windows Phone 8
segment.target: Windows Phone 8

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: To enroll your device:
segment.target: To enroll your device:

segment.source: Go to Windows Settings and tap Accounts.
segment.target: Go to Windows Settings and tap Accounts.

segment.source: Tap Your account.
segment.target: Tap Your account.

segment.source: Tap Add a work or school account.
segment.target: Tap Add a work or school account.

segment.source: Sign in with your work or school credentials.
segment.target: Sign in with your work or school credentials.

segment.source: If you followed the steps above, but still can't access your work or school email, files, and other data, go back to Accounts and tap Work access.
segment.target: If you followed the steps above, but still can't access your work or school email, files, and other data, go back to Accounts and tap Work access.

segment.source: If you see your work or school account, congratulations.
segment.target: If you see your work or school account, congratulations.

segment.source: You’re connected.
segment.target: You’re connected.

segment.source: If you don’t see your work or school account, tap Connect, and then sign in with your work or school credentials.
segment.target: If you don’t see your work or school account, tap Connect, and then sign in with your work or school credentials.

segment.source: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.
segment.target: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.

segment.source: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.
segment.target: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.

segment.source: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.
segment.target: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.

segment.source: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.
segment.target: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.

segment.source: Tap Start > Store.
segment.target: Tap Start > Store.

segment.source: Tap Search and type company portal.
segment.target: Tap Search and type company portal.

segment.source: In the list of results, tap Company Portal > Install.
segment.target: In the list of results, tap Company Portal > Install.

segment.source: Tap either Install or Free.
segment.target: Tap either Install or Free.

segment.source: The option shown depends on how your company configured the app.
segment.target: The option shown depends on how your company configured the app.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1

segment.source: To enroll your device:
segment.target: To enroll your device:

segment.source: On the device, tap Settings > PC Settings > Network > Workplace.
segment.target: On the device, tap Settings > PC Settings > Network > Workplace.

segment.source: Enter your work or school email for the User ID, if required, and then tap Join.
segment.target: Enter your work or school email for the User ID, if required, and then tap Join.

segment.source: If your user ID is not required, the email address that you entered when you logged into this device is used.
segment.target: If your user ID is not required, the email address that you entered when you logged into this device is used.

segment.source: Type the password for your work or school email.
segment.target: Type the password for your work or school email.

segment.source: Under Turn on device management, tap Turn on.
segment.target: Under Turn on device management, tap Turn on.

segment.source: In the Allow apps and services from IT admin dialog, select the I agree check box, and then tap Turn on.
segment.target: In the Allow apps and services from IT admin dialog, select the I agree check box, and then tap Turn on.

segment.source: When you have successfully enrolled, you'll see the following screen.
segment.target: When you have successfully enrolled, you'll see the following screen.

segment.source: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.
segment.target: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.

segment.source: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.
segment.target: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.

segment.source: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.
segment.target: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.

segment.source: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.
segment.target: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.

segment.source: Tap Start > Store.
segment.target: Tap Start > Store.

segment.source: Tap Search and type company portal.
segment.target: Tap Search and type company portal.

segment.source: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.
segment.target: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.

segment.source: Tap either Install or Free.
segment.target: Tap either Install or Free.

segment.source: The option shown depends on how your company configured the app.
segment.target: The option shown depends on how your company configured the app.

segment.source: Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT

segment.source: To enroll your device:
segment.target: To enroll your device:

segment.source: Tap Start, and then type System Configuration.
segment.target: Tap Start, and then type System Configuration.

segment.source: Tap the dialog box to open the Company Apps.
segment.target: Tap the dialog box to open the Company Apps.

segment.source: You may be asked to accept your company’s Terms and Conditions.
segment.target: You may be asked to accept your company’s Terms and Conditions.

segment.source: Sign in using your credentials.
segment.target: Sign in using your credentials.

segment.source: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.
segment.target: We also recommend that you install the Company Portal app, which lets you easily identify and get the company apps that are relevant to you and your role.

segment.source: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.
segment.target: Depending on how your company configured Intune, the Company Portal app may have been installed as part of your enrollment process.

segment.source: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.
segment.target: To check if you have the app, look for Company Portal in your apps list.

segment.source: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.
segment.target: If you don't see the Company Portal in your list of apps, follow these steps to install it.

segment.source: Tap Start > Store.
segment.target: Tap Start > Store.

segment.source: Tap Search and type company portal.
segment.target: Tap Search and type company portal.

segment.source: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.
segment.target: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.

segment.source: Tap Company Portal > Install.
segment.target: Tap Company Portal > Install.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1

segment.source: To enroll your device in Intune, follow the instructions that apply to your company:
segment.target: To enroll your device in Intune, follow the instructions that apply to your company:

segment.source: If your company lets you use the Company Portal from the Windows Store
segment.target: If your company lets you use the Company Portal from the Windows Store

segment.source: If you aren’t allowed to access the Windows Store from your Windows Phone, or if you don’t have a Microsoft Account
segment.target: If you aren’t allowed to access the Windows Store from your Windows Phone, or if you don’t have a Microsoft Account

segment.source: If your company lets you use the Company Portal from the Windows Store
segment.target: If your company lets you use the Company Portal from the Windows Store

segment.source: Install the Company Portal app on your device:
segment.target: Install the Company Portal app on your device:

segment.source: Tap Start > Store.
segment.target: Tap Start > Store.

segment.source: Tap Search and type company portal.
segment.target: Tap Search and type company portal.

segment.source: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.
segment.target: In the list of results, tap Company Portal.

segment.source: Tap Company Portal > Install.
segment.target: Tap Company Portal > Install.

segment.source: Enroll your device:
segment.target: Enroll your device:

segment.source: On the device, open the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app.
segment.target: On the device, open the Microsoft Intune Company Portal app.

segment.source: Provide your credentials.
segment.target: Provide your credentials.

segment.source: You may be asked to accept your company’s Terms and Conditions, if applicable.
segment.target: You may be asked to accept your company’s Terms and Conditions, if applicable.

segment.source: Swipe to My Devices.
segment.target: Swipe to My Devices.

segment.source: Tap Tap to enroll or identify this device.
segment.target: Tap Tap to enroll or identify this device.

segment.source: Tap Enroll this device.
segment.target: Tap Enroll this device.

segment.source: Tap Add account.
segment.target: Tap Add account.

segment.source: Enter additional information as requested and then tap sign in to complete the enrollment.
segment.target: Enter additional information as requested and then tap sign in to complete the enrollment.

segment.source: You should now see your workplace account listed on the Settings > Workplace page.
segment.target: You should now see your workplace account listed on the Settings > Workplace page.

segment.source: If you aren’t allowed to access the Windows Store from your Windows Phone, or if you don’t have a Microsoft Account
segment.target: If you aren’t allowed to access the Windows Store from your Windows Phone, or if you don’t have a Microsoft Account

segment.source: Tap Settings > workplace.
segment.target: Tap Settings > workplace.

segment.source: Tap add account, and then sign in using your work account.
segment.target: Tap add account, and then sign in using your work account.

segment.source: Enter additional information as requested, and then tap sign in to complete the enrollment.
segment.target: Enter additional information as requested, and then tap sign in to complete the enrollment.

segment.source: If prompted to install the company app or Hub, make sure the relevant box is checked and then tap done.
segment.target: If prompted to install the company app or Hub, make sure the relevant box is checked and then tap done.

segment.source: If your IT admin has configured the Company Portal to be installed during enrollment, you will see the Company Portal appear in your app list.
segment.target: If your IT admin has configured the Company Portal to be installed during enrollment, you will see the Company Portal appear in your app list.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8
segment.target: Windows Phone 8

segment.source: Enroll your device:
segment.target: Enroll your device:

segment.source: On the device, tap Settings > company apps.
segment.target: On the device, tap Settings > company apps.

segment.source: Tap add account, and then sign in using your work account.
segment.target: Tap add account, and then sign in using your work account.

segment.source: After the account is successfully added, you should be prompted to install the company app or Hub.
segment.target: After the account is successfully added, you should be prompted to install the company app or Hub.

segment.source: Make sure the relevant box is checked and then tap done.
segment.target: Make sure the relevant box is checked and then tap done.

segment.source: The Company Portal will appear in your app list after it is installed.
segment.target: The Company Portal will appear in your app list after it is installed.

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my device in Intune?

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 10 device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 10 device in Intune?

segment.source: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 10 Enterprise or Professional device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:
segment.target: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 10 Enterprise or Professional device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:

segment.source: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files
segment.target: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files

segment.source: Get company apps from the Company Portal
segment.target: Get company apps from the Company Portal

segment.source: Automatically configure your company email account
segment.target: Automatically configure your company email account

segment.source: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen
segment.target: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen

segment.source: For the steps to enroll, see Windows 10.
segment.target: For the steps to enroll, see Windows 10.

segment.source: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?
segment.target: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?

segment.source: When you add a computer:
segment.target: When you add a computer:

segment.source: You’ll have some software installed on your computer to make it possible for your IT administrator to manage the computer, and make it possible for you to get to company resources like apps and support information.
segment.target: You’ll have some software installed on your computer to make it possible for your IT administrator to manage the computer, and make it possible for you to get to company resources like apps and support information.

segment.source: This software may be updated automatically by your IT administrator.
segment.target: This software may be updated automatically by your IT administrator.

segment.source: Endpoint Protection may be installed on your computer.
segment.target: Endpoint Protection may be installed on your computer.

segment.source: This is software that checks for viruses and malware.
segment.target: This is software that checks for viruses and malware.

segment.source: For more information, please refer to the Endpoint Protection Privacy Statement.
segment.target: For more information, please refer to the Endpoint Protection Privacy Statement.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can take an inventory of all of the software installed on the computer, including software you have personally installed.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can take an inventory of all of the software installed on the computer, including software you have personally installed.

segment.source: Require you to accept terms and conditions.
segment.target: Require you to accept terms and conditions.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can collect or delete data from your computer’s hard drive.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can collect or delete data from your computer’s hard drive.

segment.source: Your IT administrator could also delete the entire hard drive.
segment.target: Your IT administrator could also delete the entire hard drive.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can install apps and updates on your computer.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can install apps and updates on your computer.

segment.source: Your IT administrator may enforce policies on the computer.
segment.target: Your IT administrator may enforce policies on the computer.

segment.source: For example, you might be required to set a password or PIN on the computer, which may lock you out of the computer, or delete all data from your computer’s hard drive, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.
segment.target: For example, you might be required to set a password or PIN on the computer, which may lock you out of the computer, or delete all data from your computer’s hard drive, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 8.1 or Windows RT device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 8.1 or Windows RT device in Intune?

segment.source: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 8.1 Enterprise or Professional or Windows RT device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:
segment.target: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 8.1 Enterprise or Professional or Windows RT device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:

segment.source: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files
segment.target: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files

segment.source: Get company apps from the Company Portal
segment.target: Get company apps from the Company Portal

segment.source: Automatically configure your company email account
segment.target: Automatically configure your company email account

segment.source: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen
segment.target: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen

segment.source: For the steps to enroll, see Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1.
segment.target: For the steps to enroll, see Windows 8.1 or Windows RT 8.1.

segment.source: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?
segment.target: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?

segment.source: When you add a computer:
segment.target: When you add a computer:

segment.source: You’ll have some software installed on your computer to make it possible for your IT administrator to manage the computer, and make it possible for you to get to company resources like apps and support information.
segment.target: You’ll have some software installed on your computer to make it possible for your IT administrator to manage the computer, and make it possible for you to get to company resources like apps and support information.

segment.source: This software may be updated automatically by your IT administrator.
segment.target: This software may be updated automatically by your IT administrator.

segment.source: Endpoint Protection may be installed on your computer.
segment.target: Endpoint Protection may be installed on your computer.

segment.source: This is software that checks for viruses and malware.
segment.target: This is software that checks for viruses and malware.

segment.source: For more information, please refer to the Endpoint Protection Privacy Statement.
segment.target: For more information, please refer to the Endpoint Protection Privacy Statement.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can take an inventory of all of the software installed on the computer, including software you have personally installed.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can take an inventory of all of the software installed on the computer, including software you have personally installed.

segment.source: Require you to accept terms and conditions.
segment.target: Require you to accept terms and conditions.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can collect or delete data from your computer’s hard drive.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can collect or delete data from your computer’s hard drive.

segment.source: Your IT administrator could also delete the entire hard drive.
segment.target: Your IT administrator could also delete the entire hard drive.

segment.source: Your IT administrator can install apps and updates on your computer.
segment.target: Your IT administrator can install apps and updates on your computer.

segment.source: Your IT administrator may enforce policies on the computer.
segment.target: Your IT administrator may enforce policies on the computer.

segment.source: For example, you might be required to set a password or PIN on the computer, which may lock you out of the computer, or delete all data from your computer’s hard drive, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.
segment.target: For example, you might be required to set a password or PIN on the computer, which may lock you out of the computer, or delete all data from your computer’s hard drive, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8 device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8 device in Intune?

segment.source: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8 device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:
segment.target: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8 device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:

segment.source: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files
segment.target: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files

segment.source: Get company apps from the Company Portal
segment.target: Get company apps from the Company Portal

segment.source: Automatically configure your company email account
segment.target: Automatically configure your company email account

segment.source: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen
segment.target: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen

segment.source: For the steps to enroll, seeWindows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.
segment.target: For the steps to enroll, seeWindows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8.

segment.source: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?.
segment.target: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?.

segment.source: When you add your Windows Phone device, you are giving your IT administrator permission to access the device.
segment.target: When you add your Windows Phone device, you are giving your IT administrator permission to access the device.

segment.source: They can do things like:
segment.target: They can do things like:

segment.source: Reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings.
segment.target: Reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings.

segment.source: This is helpful if the device is lost or stolen.
segment.target: This is helpful if the device is lost or stolen.

segment.source: Remove all company related data and business apps that were installed.
segment.target: Remove all company related data and business apps that were installed.

segment.source: Your personal data and settings aren’t removed.
segment.target: Your personal data and settings aren’t removed.

segment.source: Force you to have a password or PIN on the device, which may lock you out of the device, or reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings, which may include the deletion of data, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.
segment.target: Force you to have a password or PIN on the device, which may lock you out of the device, or reset your device back to manufacturer’s default settings, which may include the deletion of data, if there are too many incorrect password attempts.

segment.source: Force all the data on the device to be encrypted.
segment.target: Force all the data on the device to be encrypted.

segment.source: This helps protect the data if the device is lost or stolen.
segment.target: This helps protect the data if the device is lost or stolen.

segment.source: Require you to accept terms and conditions.
segment.target: Require you to accept terms and conditions.

segment.source: Disable the SD card.
segment.target: Disable the SD card.

segment.source: Install updates to apps on your device.
segment.target: Install updates to apps on your device.

segment.source: This applies to updates only.
segment.target: This applies to updates only.

segment.source: Your IT administrator cannot force new apps to install on your device, but you can choose to install apps you see in the company portal.
segment.target: Your IT administrator cannot force new apps to install on your device, but you can choose to install apps you see in the company portal.

segment.source: After your device is added to the company portal, approximately every 8 hours it will:
segment.target: After your device is added to the company portal, approximately every 8 hours it will:

segment.source: Download any policy or app updates that your IT administrator has made available.
segment.target: Download any policy or app updates that your IT administrator has made available.

segment.source: Send any hardware inventory updates.
segment.target: Send any hardware inventory updates.

segment.source: Send any company app inventory updates.
segment.target: Send any company app inventory updates.

segment.source: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 7 or Vista device in Intune?
segment.target: What happens when I install the Company Portal app and enroll my Windows 7 or Vista device in Intune?

segment.source: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 7 or Vista device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:
segment.target: When you install the Company Portal app and then use the app to enroll your Windows 7 or Vista device in Intune, you can then use the Company Portal app to:

segment.source: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files
segment.target: Access the company’s network, and your email and work files

segment.source: Get company apps from the Company Portal
segment.target: Get company apps from the Company Portal

segment.source: Automatically configure your company email account
segment.target: Automatically configure your company email account

segment.source: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen
segment.target: Reset your phone to factory settings if it is lost or stolen

segment.source: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?.
segment.target: For information about what your IT admin can and can't see on your device, see What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?.

segment.target: Your IT administrator could also delete the entire hard drive.

segment.source: What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?
segment.target: What can my IT admin see when I enroll my device in Intune?

segment.source: When you enroll your device in Intune, you are giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.
segment.target: When you enroll your device in Intune, you are giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.

segment.source: What IT cannot see
segment.target: What IT cannot see

segment.source: Call history
segment.target: Call history

segment.source: Text messages
segment.target: Text messages

segment.source: Personal email, contacts, and calendar
segment.target: Personal email, contacts, and calendar

segment.target: Web history

segment.source: What is the Company Portal website?
segment.target: What is the Company Portal website?

segment.source: The Company Portal website is your company’s web interface that you use to manage your work computers and devices, and your personal computers and devices that you choose to use at work.
segment.target: The Company Portal website is your company’s web interface that you use to manage your work computers and devices, and your personal computers and devices that you choose to use at work.

segment.source: Once you add your computer or device to the Company Portal, you can:
segment.target: Once you add your computer or device to the Company Portal, you can:

segment.source: Browse for and download company apps
segment.target: Browse for and download company apps

segment.source: Manage devices that you have added to the Company Portal
segment.target: Manage devices that you have added to the Company Portal

segment.source: Find contact information for your IT administrator
segment.target: Find contact information for your IT administrator

segment.source: When you add a computer or device to the Company Portal, some software may be installed or an app may be downloaded (depending on the device).
segment.target: When you add a computer or device to the Company Portal, some software may be installed or an app may be downloaded (depending on the device).

segment.source: You are also giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.
segment.target: You are also giving your IT administrator permission to manage your device to help protect the company information on the device.

segment.source: Encrypt your device
segment.target: Encrypt your device

segment.source: You can encrypt your device either by adding a Microsoft account or by enabling BitLocker.
segment.target: You can encrypt your device either by adding a Microsoft account or by enabling BitLocker.

segment.source: Option 1: Add a Microsoft account
segment.target: Option 1: Add a Microsoft account

segment.source: Search for, then start the PC Settings app.
segment.target: Search for, then start the PC Settings app.

segment.source: Click Accounts > Your account, and then click Connect to a Microsoft account.
segment.target: Click Accounts > Your account, and then click Connect to a Microsoft account.

segment.source: Follow the instructions shown.
segment.target: Follow the instructions shown.

segment.source: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device to use it at work.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device to use it at work.

segment.source: Option 2: Enable BitLocker
segment.target: Option 2: Enable BitLocker

segment.source: Search for, then start the Manage BitLocker app.
segment.target: Search for, then start the Manage BitLocker app.

segment.source: Click Turn on BitLocker, then follow the instructions shown to encrypt each of your drives.
segment.target: Click Turn on BitLocker, then follow the instructions shown to encrypt each of your drives.

segment.source: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device to use it at work.
segment.target: Ensure that your device is enrolled with by following the instructions in Enroll your device to use it at work.

segment.source: Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device
segment.target: Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device

segment.source: If your device is enrolled in Intune, and your device is lost or stolen, you can reset it to factory defaults.
segment.target: If your device is enrolled in Intune, and your device is lost or stolen, you can reset it to factory defaults.

segment.source: Resetting a device to factor defaults removes both your personal and work information from it.
segment.target: Resetting a device to factor defaults removes both your personal and work information from it.

segment.source: For more about what happens when you reset your device, see What happens if I reset my Windows device using the Company Portal?.
segment.target: For more about what happens when you reset your device, see What happens if I reset my Windows device using the Company Portal?.

segment.source: In your browser, open your Company Portal, and sign in to your work account.
segment.target: In your browser, open your Company Portal, and sign in to your work account.

segment.source: Under My Devices, select the lost or stolen device.
segment.target: Under My Devices, select the lost or stolen device.

segment.source: Tap Reset > Reset.
segment.target: Tap Reset > Reset.

segment.source: If you are unable to reset your lost or stolen device, contact IT to reset it for you.
segment.target: If you are unable to reset your lost or stolen device, contact IT to reset it for you.

segment.source: What happens if I reset my Windows device using the Company Portal?
segment.target: What happens if I reset my Windows device using the Company Portal?

segment.source: When you use the Company Portal to reset your personal device, some apps and settings on your device may be deleted, including some of your personal data.
segment.target: When you use the Company Portal to reset your personal device, some apps and settings on your device may be deleted, including some of your personal data.

segment.source: What happens on each device depends on the type of device you have and how you are using the device, as described in the following table.
segment.target: What happens on each device depends on the type of device you have and how you are using the device, as described in the following table.

segment.source: For instructions on how to reset your lost or stolen device, see Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device.
segment.target: For instructions on how to reset your lost or stolen device, see Reset (erase) your lost or stolen device.

segment.source: Device configuration and management
segment.target: Device configuration and management

segment.source: Device type
segment.target: Device type

segment.source: Your IT admin manages your mobile device
segment.target: Your IT admin manages your mobile device

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: When you reset your Android device, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: iOS Devices (iPhone and iPad), your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s default settings.
segment.target: iOS Devices (iPhone and iPad), your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s default settings.

segment.source: Your personal data, apps and settings will be removed.
segment.target: Your personal data, apps and settings will be removed.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s default settings.
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8, your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s default settings.

segment.source: Your personal data, apps and settings will be removed.
segment.target: Your personal data, apps and settings will be removed.

segment.source: Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT

segment.source: You cannot reset a Windows RT device unless it is used for email only.
segment.target: You cannot reset a Windows RT device unless it is used for email only.

segment.source: Your device can access company email only
segment.target: Your device can access company email only

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s defaults.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and the company portal tries to reset the device back to the manufacturer’s defaults.

segment.source: All your personal data and settings will be removed.
segment.target: All your personal data and settings will be removed.

segment.source: iOS Devices (iPhone and iPad)
segment.target: iOS Devices (iPhone and iPad)

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 and Windows Phone 8

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: Windows 7 or Windows Vista Computers
segment.target: Windows 7 or Windows Vista Computers

segment.source: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 7 or earlier that is used for email only.
segment.target: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 7 or earlier that is used for email only.

segment.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 Computers
segment.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 Computers

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore and your company email account will be deleted and unsaved email will be deleted.

segment.source: PCs and laptops
segment.target: PCs and laptops

segment.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 Computers
segment.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows 8 Computers

segment.source: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 8 or Windows 8.1 unless it is used for email only.
segment.target: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 8 or Windows 8.1 unless it is used for email only.

segment.source: Windows 7 or Windows Vista Computers
segment.target: Windows 7 or Windows Vista Computers

segment.source: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 7 or earlier.
segment.target: You cannot reset a computer that is running Windows 7 or earlier.

segment.source: Unenroll your device from Intune
segment.target: Unenroll your device from Intune

segment.source: If you enrolled in Intune, but no longer want to use your device for work or school and don't need to access work or school email, apps, or other resources, you need to unenroll your device.
segment.target: If you enrolled in Intune, but no longer want to use your device for work or school and don't need to access work or school email, apps, or other resources, you need to unenroll your device.

segment.source: Once you unenroll your device from Intune, you will no longer be able to access these resources.
segment.target: Once you unenroll your device from Intune, you will no longer be able to access these resources.

segment.source: For more about what happens when you unenroll your device, see What happens when I remove my device from the Company Portal?.
segment.target: For more about what happens when you unenroll your device, see What happens when I remove my device from the Company Portal?.

segment.source: To unenroll your device, use the steps that match the device you're using.
segment.target: To unenroll your device, use the steps that match the device you're using.

segment.source: Unenroll your Windows 10 device
segment.target: Unenroll your Windows 10 device

segment.source: From your apps list, tap the Company Portal app.
segment.target: From your apps list, tap the Company Portal app.

segment.source: Sign in using your work or school credentials.
segment.target: Sign in using your work or school credentials.

segment.source: In My Devices, select the device you want to unenroll.
segment.target: In My Devices, select the device you want to unenroll.

segment.source: Tap Remove > Remove.
segment.target: Tap Remove > Remove.

segment.source: Unenroll your Windows 8.1 computer
segment.target: Unenroll your Windows 8.1 computer

segment.source: Go to PC Settings > Network > Workplace.
segment.target: Go to PC Settings > Network > Workplace.

segment.source: Under Workplace Join, tap Leave.
segment.target: Under Workplace Join, tap Leave.

segment.source: Under Turn on device management, tap Turn off.
segment.target: Under Turn on device management, tap Turn off.

segment.source: On the popup window that opens, tap Turn off.
segment.target: On the popup window that opens, tap Turn off.

segment.source: Unenroll your Windows Phone 8.1 device
segment.target: Unenroll your Windows Phone 8.1 device

segment.source: Go to Settings > Workplace.
segment.target: Go to Settings > Workplace.

segment.source: Tap the workplace account that you want to unenroll.
segment.target: Tap the workplace account that you want to unenroll.

segment.source: Tap Delete at the bottom of the screen.
segment.target: Tap Delete at the bottom of the screen.

segment.source: On the Delete account dialog, tap Delete.
segment.target: On the Delete account dialog, tap Delete.

segment.source: What happens when I remove my device from the Company Portal?
segment.target: What happens when I remove my device from the Company Portal?

segment.source: The following events happen when you remove my device from the Company Portal
segment.target: The following events happen when you remove my device from the Company Portal

segment.source: Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8
segment.target: Windows Phone 8.1 or Windows Phone 8

segment.source: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal app or Company Portal website.
segment.target: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal app or Company Portal website.

segment.source: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.
segment.target: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.

segment.source: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.
segment.target: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.

segment.source: The only exception to this is encryption policies, which will still apply.
segment.target: The only exception to this is encryption policies, which will still apply.

segment.source: If your company policy required that your Windows Phone be encrypted, the only way to unencrypt your phone is to reset your phone using the Settings menu on your Windows Phone.
segment.target: If your company policy required that your Windows Phone be encrypted, the only way to unencrypt your phone is to reset your phone using the Settings menu on your Windows Phone.

segment.source: Windows RT running Windows 8.1 or Windows RT
segment.target: Windows RT running Windows 8.1 or Windows RT

segment.source: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal.
segment.target: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal.

segment.source: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.
segment.target: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.

segment.source: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.
segment.target: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.

segment.source: You might not be able to connect to your company network using Wi-Fi or a Virtual Private Network anymore.
segment.target: You might not be able to connect to your company network using Wi-Fi or a Virtual Private Network anymore.

segment.source: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.
segment.target: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.

segment.source: Some mail apps, such as Windows Mail, won’t be able to access company email that is stored on your device anymore.
segment.target: Some mail apps, such as Windows Mail, won’t be able to access company email that is stored on your device anymore.

segment.source: When you remove your Windows RT device, the following happens:
segment.target: When you remove your Windows RT device, the following happens:

segment.source: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal.
segment.target: The Company Portal app is uninstalled from your device, which means that your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you won't be able to install apps from the Company Portal.

segment.source: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.
segment.target: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.

segment.source: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.
segment.target: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it, for example disabling the camera, or requiring a certain password length, will no longer apply.

segment.source: Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7, Vista
segment.target: Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7, Vista

segment.source: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you can’t install apps from the company portal anymore.
segment.target: Your device won’t appear in the company portal anymore, and you can’t install apps from the company portal anymore.

segment.source: If you installed the client software, it’s removed from your computer.
segment.target: If you installed the client software, it’s removed from your computer.

segment.source: The Endpoint Protection software is removed from your computer.
segment.target: The Endpoint Protection software is removed from your computer.

segment.source: If your computer has other virus protection software installed and it is disabled, that software may be re-enabled after Endpoint Protection is removed.
segment.target: If your computer has other virus protection software installed and it is disabled, that software may be re-enabled after Endpoint Protection is removed.

segment.source: You should check your computer after removing it from the company portal.
segment.target: You should check your computer after removing it from the company portal.

segment.source: If the other virus protection software is not re-enabled or no other virus protection software is installed, your computer may be vulnerable to viruses and malware.
segment.target: If the other virus protection software is not re-enabled or no other virus protection software is installed, your computer may be vulnerable to viruses and malware.

segment.source: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it (for example, disabling the camera, will no longer apply).
segment.target: Any settings that were changed on your device when you added it (for example, disabling the camera, will no longer apply).

segment.source: Your computer will no longer receive automatic software updates or antivirus software updates from the service.
segment.target: Your computer will no longer receive automatic software updates or antivirus software updates from the service.

segment.source: However, depending on how it is configured, your computer may still receive updates from the Windows Server Update Services, Windows Update, or Microsoft Update.
segment.target: However, depending on how it is configured, your computer may still receive updates from the Windows Server Update Services, Windows Update, or Microsoft Update.

segment.source: In addition, for Windows 8.1:
segment.target: In addition, for Windows 8.1:

segment.source: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.
segment.target: You can’t use company apps and company data on your device anymore.

segment.source: Some mail apps, such as Windows Mail, won’t be able to access company email that is stored on your device anymore.
segment.target: Some mail apps, such as Windows Mail, won’t be able to access company email that is stored on your device anymore.

segment.source: You might not be able to connect to your company network using Wi-Fi or a Virtual Private Network.
segment.target: You might not be able to connect to your company network using Wi-Fi or a Virtual Private Network.

segment.source: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.
segment.target: You might not have access to some company resources, such as file shares or internal web sites, on your device anymore.

segment.source: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection
segment.target: Turn off Microsoft usage data collection

segment.source: In order to improve its products and services, Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the reliability and performance of the Company Portal app and how it is used.
segment.target: In order to improve its products and services, Microsoft automatically collects anonymous data about the reliability and performance of the Company Portal app and how it is used.

segment.source: You can turn off the collection of that data by using the Usage Data setting in the Company Portal app.
segment.target: You can turn off the collection of that data by using the Usage Data setting in the Company Portal app.

segment.source: IT administrators have no control over the collection of the data, and they cannot change your selection for the setting.
segment.target: IT administrators have no control over the collection of the data, and they cannot change your selection for the setting.

segment.source: Fix issues with your device
segment.target: Fix issues with your device

segment.source: Use this information to fix issues with your device when you're trying to install the Company Portal app, enroll your device in Intune, or if you've already enrolled in Intune.
segment.target: Use this information to fix issues with your device when you're trying to install the Company Portal app, enroll your device in Intune, or if you've already enrolled in Intune.

segment.source: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't have the required minimum operating system version

segment.source: Your device doesn’t meet the minimum operating system version required by your IT department.
segment.target: Your device doesn’t meet the minimum operating system version required by your IT department.

segment.source: Before updating your mobile device, check the current operating system version by tapping Settings > about, and then tap Settings > phone update > check for updates to update your device.
segment.target: Before updating your mobile device, check the current operating system version by tapping Settings > about, and then tap Settings > phone update > check for updates to update your device.

segment.source: Before updating your computer, search for operating system and follow the prompts to identify your current operating system version.
segment.target: Before updating your computer, search for operating system and follow the prompts to identify your current operating system version.

segment.source: To update computers with operating systems earlier than Windows 10, search for Windows updates.
segment.target: To update computers with operating systems earlier than Windows 10, search for Windows updates.

segment.source: If your Windows operating system version is 8.1, you’ll see 6.3.xxxx instead of 8.1 when you check your update version.
segment.target: If your Windows operating system version is 8.1, you’ll see 6.3.xxxx instead of 8.1 when you check your update version.

segment.source: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version
segment.target: Device doesn't comply with the maximum operating system version

segment.source: Your device does not comply with your IT admin's policy for the maximum version of the operating system.
segment.target: Your device does not comply with your IT admin's policy for the maximum version of the operating system.

segment.source: Contact your IT admin for help.
segment.target: Contact your IT admin for help.
